org.jamesframework.core.search.stopcriteria

Class StopCriterionChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.search.stopcriteria.StopCriterionChecker

  • public class StopCriterionChecker
extends Object
    A stop criterion checker is responsible for checking the stop criteria of a given search, while this search is running. At construction, a reference to the search is given. Stop criteria can be added using add(StopCriterion), which usually only happens from within the search, which passes all its stop criteria to its dedicated checker after verifying compatibility.

    When startChecking() is called, a task will be scheduled to periodically check the stop criteria in the background, by default with a period of 1 second, while the search is running. These tasks are executed by a dedicated thread which is shared among all stop criterion checker instances, as checking stop criteria is not an intensive task. A manual request to immediately check all stop criteria can also be made by calling checkNow().

    As soon as some stop criterion is satisfied, the checker will request the search to stop and will also cancel the scheduled task for further execution.

    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Constructor Detail

      • StopCriterionChecker

        public StopCriterionChecker(Search<?> search)
        Create a stop criterion checker dedicated to checking the stop criteria of the given search. By default, consecutive checks will be separated with a period of 1 second. This can be customized using setPeriod(long, TimeUnit).
        Parameters:
        search - search for which the stop criteria should be checked while running

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(StopCriterion stopCriterion)
        Add a stop criterion to check.
        Parameters:
        stopCriterion - stop criterion to add

      • remove

        public boolean remove(StopCriterion stopCriterion)
        Remove a stop criterion. Returns false if the given stop criterion had never been added.
        Parameters:
        stopCriterion - stop criterion to remove
        Returns:
        true if the stop criterion has successfully been removed

      • setPeriod

        public void setPeriod(long period,
                      TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Set the period between consecutive stop criterion checks. By default, this period is set to 1 second. The new settings will apply as from the next call of startChecking().
        Parameters:
        period - period between two checks
        timeUnit - time unit of this period

      • startChecking

        public void startChecking()
        Start checking the stop criteria, in a separate background thread. If the stop criterion checker is already active, or if no stop criteria have been added, calling this method does not have any effect.

      • stopChecking

        public void stopChecking()
        Instructs the stop criterion checker to stop checking. In case the checker is not active, calling this method does not have any effect.

      • checkNow

        public void checkNow()
        Force the checker to check all stop criteria now.
